page.title: 16OWER FARM RACING STABLES
page.content: The Stables were opened in the early 1930's. In those days over fifty prime horses were trained there, but during the second world war the place had to be partially closed down, and it never returned to its full capacity. There are twenty race horses there now. They are exercised in three strings every day, there being enough staff to ride each horse over Corhampton Downs. The horses are raced at Courses such as Salisbury, Lingfield, Warwick and Newbury. Each horse has its own stable and its own lad, who grooms and mucks it out and sees to its feed. The owner of the racing stables inspects the horses each morning and night as well as keeping a careful eye on their training and general wellbeing.
